content.description: Start with hands in the seam that divides the rock angle change.  Establish feet on the slab section and then make your way up to the lip and mantle to top out.
content.location: In the middle of this rock face slightly right of the tree that is grown just in front of this rock.

content.description: Definitely the king line in the hole and potentially in all of this bouldering area.  I have not sent it yet but after doing some of the crux moves in isolation it feels somewhere around V11 to V13.  This is slightly above my current ability so if any crusher wants to come get it, it requires really good crimping ability and core strength.  Probs needs cold weather conditions too, but as Alex Megos said, "There is no bad conditions, only weakness"
content.location: In the hole on the right side of the 40 degree overhanging face.

content.description: Do you like use no foot technique and just using pure muscle to climb?  Then this is the climb for you.  Just as my pal Gorilla Rick would climb, you just need to grip hard.
content.location: Somewhere in the back of the conglomerate of rock.  I'll have a topo at some point.

content.description: Start in the hole on the left side of the 40 degree overhanging face.  Blast the one move wonder crux move at the beginning and finish with some V4 moves to top out being sure not to dab on any of the rocks behind you.
content.location: In the hole somewhere in the conglomerate of rocks.  Not gonna lie, it's kinda hard to find.  I'll try and get a good topo soon.

content.description: This area is the conglomerate of rock located on the opposite side of the Appalachian Trail than the rest of the areas near it.
